title: War and athletes - kelley more shook up over quake than war
author: Unknown
text: In 1989, when the earthquake shook, so did Steve Kelley's head in regards to continuing the World Series. He said he didn't care about baseball then. ``The Series should be canceled, who cares? There are more important things in life,'' he said         Now just over a year later, we are at war. And now Mr. Kelley says play ball, ``a diversion is what we need.''         I wonder at what level of rationale did Mr. Kelley come to ease his conciousness. I can only conclude one of three things:         --  Because the war waged is 5,000 miles away, it's out of sight, out of mind.         --  Mother Nature is more evil than Saddam Hussein.         --  Mr. Kelley prefers football over baseball.    A.E. Ringwood, Federal Wa
